SEARCH
Module com.learneria.controller
Package com.learneria.utils

Class SceneManager

java.lang.Object
com.learneria.utils.SceneManager
public class SceneManager extends Object
The SceneManager class provides a centralised way to manage scene navigation, controller communication, and user session tracking across the Papa Learneria JavaFX application.

It supports:

  • Scene switching with or without controller access
  • Global stylesheet application
  • Role-based navigation (teacher/student)
  • Popup modal creation

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneManager

      public SceneManager()

  • Method Details

    • setStage

      public static void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Assigns the primary stage of the application. This should be called once in Main.java during startup.
      Parameters:
      stage - the JavaFX Stage used as the main application window

    • setCurrentUser

      public static void setCurrentUser(String username, String role)
      Saves the current logged-in user's username and role for session use.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the current user
      role - the role of the user (e.g., "teacher" or "student")

    • getCurrentUser

      public static String getCurrentUser()
      Returns the username of the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      current username

    • getCurrentRole

      public static String getCurrentRole()
      Returns the role of the current user.
      Returns:
      the user’s role string

    • switchScene

      public static void switchScene(String fxmlPath, String title)
      Switches the current scene to a new FXML layout. Automatically applies the global stylesheet and injects the current username into controllers implementing UserAware.
      Parameters:
      fxmlPath - path to the FXML file (relative to the resource root)
      title - title of the window

    • switchSceneWithController

      public static void switchSceneWithController(String fxmlPath, String title, Consumer<Object> controllerConsumer)
      Switches to a new scene and provides the loaded controller to a custom consumer for setup. Useful when data or configuration must be passed to the new scene’s controller before display.

      Example usage: 

       SceneManager.switchSceneWithController("/path.fxml", "Title", controller -> {
     if (controller instanceof SomeController c) c.setData(...);
 });
      Parameters:
      fxmlPath - FXML path for the new scene
      title - title of the window
      controllerConsumer - lambda function to operate on the new controller

    • goBackToDashboard

      public static void goBackToDashboard()
      Redirects the user back to their main dashboard depending on role.
      • Teacher → Teacher Main Menu
      • Student → Student Main Menu
      • Unknown → Login Screen

    • showPopupScene

      public static void showPopupScene(String fxmlPath, String title)
      Displays a modal popup window for quick alerts, confirmation prompts, or short forms. The popup is modal and blocks interaction with the main window until closed.
      Parameters:
      fxmlPath - path to the FXML file defining the popup
      title - title of the popup window

    • isStageReady

      public static boolean isStageReady()
      Checks whether the primary stage has been set and is ready for use.
      Returns:
      true if the stage is available, otherwise false

    • switchScene

      public static void switchScene(String s)
      Overloaded placeholder for scene switching.

      This method is intentionally left blank for potential future compatibility or simplified calls.

      Parameters:
      s - path to the FXML (currently unused)
